MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - European Space Agency.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Industry and Commerce the nature of Ireland's involvement in the European Space Agency; if he will give a list of all satelites and other payloads launched under the auspices of the European Space Agency; in each case (i) the launch date, (ii) the purpose of the satellite or payload and (iii) whether Ireland has any access to any data collected by such satelite or payload; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Industry and Commerce (Mr. R. Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Industry and Commerce (Mr. R. Burke)
Speaker.P: Ireland is a full member of the European Space Agency (ESA) and has full voting rights and complete access to all ESA programmes. However, Ireland's involvement tends to be concentrated on the programmes which offer the best potential benefits to this country in terms of industrial application and spin-off.

MainHeading.P: ESA's role is confined to the development and qualification of space products, for exclusively peaceful purposes, and the demonstration of their ability to carry out their mission. The peaceful purposes aspect of ESA is enshrined in the Convention of the Agency. ESA is not itself involved in the launching of satelites or payloads, with the exception of eight launches which were undertaken as part of the qualification and promotion phases of the Ariane Launcher Development Programme during the period December 1979 to March 1984.

ESA satellites and payloads are launched under contract, either by NASA or wherever possible by Ariane-space — which is a private commercial company set up expressly to commercialise and market the Ariane launcher. A list of all the satellites-payloads launched under the auspices of ESA is attached, together with a description of their purposes. These satellites fall into three categories: (1) Scientific satellites, (2) Applications satellites launched on a commercial basis on behalf of a customer — normally with a view to selling services or data obtained and (3) experimental or test satellites.

Ireland has free access to any data obtained from scientific satelites. Regarding the applications satellites, Ireland has free access to the data obtained by the meteorological satellites, while the telecommunications satellites are service satellites, and therefore are not involved in data collection. Finally, the data obtained from the technological or test satellites is initially restricted to the participants in the programme concerned. If Ireland has decided not to participate in the programme, then we would not have a right to the data obtained from the experiment.

The board have decided, on the basis of the moneys available, to transfer existing services to the new facilities in August this year. The opening of the new facilities will also enable them to relieve overcrowding problems in the hospital. The opening of the remainder of phase I, which includes the paediatric unit, is a matter in the first instance for the Midland Health Board and will be kept under review.

asked the Minister for Defence, in respect of all petrol driven vehicles under the direct control and responsibility of his Department, the steps he has taken to ensure that only unleaded petrol is used by such vehicles; in respect of such vehicles (a) the number of vehicles concerned, (b) the approximate number of miles travelled per annum and (c) the date when a decision to use unleaded petrol was taken and implemented; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Defence (Mr. Noonan, Limerick West) Michael J. (Limerick West) Noonan
Speaker.P: Limerick West): All petrol driven vehicles held by the military authorities may use unleaded petrol provided modifications are carried out to their engines. The question of carrying out these modifications and the supply of unleaded petrol is being examined at present.

A programme for the conversion of vehicles to use diesel fuel commenced during 1988 and vehicles purchased since July 1988 have been diesel engined. It is intended that vehicles acquired in the future will also be diesel operated. A total of 1,250 petrol driven vehicles with an annual mileage of about eight million miles is operated by my Department.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. M. Higgins Mr. M. Higgins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she will reconsider her decision in relation to the new Junior Cycle to reduce the originally proposed three levels of assessment to two, because of the inevitable impact of such reduction on weaker students.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: It is not true, as implied in the questions, that I originally proposed to have three levels of assessment for junior certificate English. My brief to the National Council for Curriculum and Assessment clearly specified assessment at two levels. As I have made clear on numerous occasions I do not believe that the introduction of a third and lower level in English would be in the best interests of any of our young people.

asked the Minister for Education, in respect of all petrol driven vehicles under the direct control and responsibility of her Department, the steps she has taken to ensure that only unleaded petrol is used by such vehicles; in respect of such vehicles (a) the number of vehicles concerned (b) the approximate number of miles travelled per annum and (c) the date when a decision to use unleaded petrol was taken and implemented; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I have had this matter examined in relation to the school transport scheme administered by my Department and I find that buses used in the operation of the scheme are diesel-fulled. Consequently the use of unleaded petrol does not arise.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Offaly Schools' Appointment.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the plans she has for the appointment of a remedial teacher to serve (a) St. Ciarán's national school, Clonmacnoise, (b) Shannonbridge national school and (c) High Street national school, County Offaly, which was recommended in 1986; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Remedial teaching posts are allocated to schools in accordance with a priority of educational need from the existing overall authorised complement of these posts, the number of which is limited because of current financial constraints. It has not been possible to allocate a remedial teacher to serve the schools referred to, but the school's applications will be considered should posts become available in the futue.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the charge for repeating the leaving certificate examination; the basis on which that sum is arrived at; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The charge for repeating the leaving certificate examination as a school candidate is £200 — £100 course fee and £100 examination fee. The decision to charge this fee was taken in the context of the very difficult financial circumstances facing the country at present. In view of the financial pressures at various levels of the educational system, it was considered not unreasonable that those who had already benefited by the normal course of post-primary schooling, and who wished to take an extra year, should be asked to make a contribution towards the cost of providing the necessary resources. Pupils whose parents or guardians are medical card holders are exempted from payment of the £100 course fee and are required to pay only the standard examination fee of £35.

asked the Minister for Education, arising out of a recent announcement she made in relation to the simplification of admissions procedures to third level colleges and the refining of grades in the leaving certificate examination, (a) the way in which she proposes to bring about these changes, (b) the consultation which is taking place at the moment and with whom and (c) when the proposed changes will be put in place.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The simplification of all aspects of admissions procedures to third level colleges are being considered at present. The third level colleges in the VEC area have made progress in the simplification of their admissions systems and in the development of a co-ordinated approach to admissions procedures. Also the computerisation of the leaving certificate results will be implemented this year.
Other desirable modifications in the admissions procedures to third level colleges and the refinement of leaving certificate grades will be pursued in consultation with the parties concerned.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Mitchell Mr. J. Mitchell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if she is in a position to approve the application for extra classrooms at St. Thomas the Apostle School, Laurel Lodge, Castleknock, Dublin 15, which are required to be in operation for next year; the number of classrooms approved; when work will commence; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The Chairman of the board of management of Laurel Lodge national school, Castleknock, Dublin 15 has requested grant aid for the provision of additional permanent accommodation at the school. The whole question is being considered in my Department at present and a decision will be conveyed to the school authorities as early as possible. I am not in a position, at this stage, to say when building works may commence.
